translation.en: - Well, I expect it'll cloud over later on. - Aye.
translation.es: - Se va a nublar más tarde. - Sí.

translation.en: What's going on at Sutton Hoo, then?
There's a lady who's got an excavating job.
translation.es: Una señora quiere hacer una excavación.

translation.en: - Ah, thank you kindly. Mind how you go. - Thank you.
Mornin'. Mrs. Pretty, please.
Basil Brown.
Wait here.
- Should we take a look at them, then? - Right.
Things like this are usually done through museums.
translation.es: Por lo general, los museos se encargan de esto.

translation.en: Yes. But when I approached Ipswich,
translation.es: Sí, pero cuando contacté al de Ipswich,

translation.en: Mr. Reid Moir said that, with the war coming, they couldn't embark upon any new ventures.
translation.es: según Reedmore, no podrán emprender proyectos nuevos por la guerra.

translation.en: Well, they have their hands full with a Roman villa.
translation.es: Están ocupados con una villa romana.

translation.en: - Yes. He said you were working on it. - I am.
translation.es: - Dijo que usted trabaja ahí. - Así es.

translation.en: He told me you were a difficult man.
translation.es: Me dijo que usted es complicado.

translation.en: Did he, now?
Unorthodox… and untrained.
translation.es: Poco ortodoxo y sin formación profesional.

translation.en: Hmm. So that's his reference, is it?
Well, I'm… I'm not untrained.
I've been on dig since I was old enough to hold a trowel.
translation.es: He excavado desde que aprendí a agarrar la pala.

translation.en: My father taught me.
Perhaps Reid Moir just wants to keep you for himself.
translation.es: Quizá Reedmore solo quiera que trabaje para él.

translation.en: - I don't know about that. -
I've always had a curiosity to see these here mounds.
translation.es: Estos túmulos siempre me dieron curiosidad.

translation.en: - Henry VIII came here to dig. - So I'm told.
translation.es: Enrique VIII hizo excavaciones aquí. Eso me dijeron.

translation.en: Well, no record of what he found.
translation.es: No hay registro de sus hallazgos.

translation.en: My husband and I bought this land, with the hope of exploring what was under there.
translation.es: Mi esposo y yo compramos esta tierra para explorar bajo la superficie,

translation.en: - But… Well, best- laid plans. -
translation.es: Mi esposo y yo compramos esta tierra para explorar bajo la superficie, pero las cosas no se nos dieron.

translation.en: What are they? Would you hazard a guess?
Burial mounds, I expect.
We're standing in someone's graveyard, I reckon.
Viking…
or maybe older.
Apparently, local girls used to lie down on them in the hope of falling pregnant.
translation.es: Las chicas se acostaban aquí para quedar embarazadas.

translation.en: I've heard plenty of legends.
Is that why you want to dig, Mrs. Pretty?
Tales of buried treasure?
My interest in archaeology began like yours, when I was scarcely old enough to hold a trowel.
translation.es: Como usted, me interesó la arqueología desde que aprendí a agarrar la pala.

translation.en: My childhood home was built on a Cistercian convent.
translation.es: Crecí en una casa sobre un convento cisterciense.

translation.en: I helped my father excavate the apse.
translation.es: Ayudé a papá a excavar el ábside.

translation.en: That speaks, don't it?
The past.
You have rabbits, Mrs. Pretty.
Yes, I am aware of that.
Rabbits burrow.
They're bad for excavations.
I'd like to start with this one.
Ah, I wouldn't start with this one, Mrs. Pretty, not personally speaking.
translation.es: Yo no comenzaría por este túmulo.

translation.en: - Why not? - 'Cause that dips in the middle, see?
translation.es: - ¿Por qué? - Por la depresión en la mitad.

translation.en: And the soil feels-- That's compacted.
translation.es: Y la tierra está muy compacta.

translation.en: Thieves used to sink shafts in.
translation.es: Los ladrones solían hundir los socavones.

translation.en: Robber's flutes, they're called.
Anything they found would've been melted down and sold long ago.
translation.es: Hace mucho tiempo fundieron y vendieron lo que encontraron.

translation.en: I expect you might be better off with…
one of these.
But I have a feeling about this one.
Well, that's your money, Mrs. Pretty, but I'd base your dig on evidence,
translation.es: Es su dinero, pero yo prefiero excavar en suelo sólido

translation.en: not feeling.
As for money, would 1 pound, 15 shillings,
and 6 pence a week be acceptable?
translation.es: de una libra, quince chelines y seis peniques?

translation.en: - No. - I asked Reid Moir what he pays.
translation.es: No. El Sr. Reedmore me dijo que le paga eso.

translation.en: - That was his reply. - Well, he don't pay enough.
translation.es: El Sr. Reedmore me dijo que le paga eso. Él no paga bien.

translation.en: - - All right. I'm afraid that's all I can reasonably afford to spend.
translation.es: Bueno, es lo máximo que puedo pagar.

translation.en: - - Right, then. Understood.
Robert, where did you get that gas mask? Take it off.
translation.es: Robert, ¿de dónde sacaste esa máscara? Quítatela.

translation.en: - Sorry, I didn't realize you were-- - This is not a toy.
translation.es: - No sabía que estabas… - No es un juguete.

translation.en: Robert, this is Mr. Brown.
- Hello there, young man. - Robert Pretty. How do you do?
translation.es: - Hola, jovencito. - Soy Robert Pretty. ¿Qué tal?

translation.en: Who's coming after you? - Captain Laska and his gangsters. - Oh!
translation.es: - ¿Quién te persigue? - El capitán Laska y sus secuaces.

translation.en: - Mr. Brown is an archaeologist. - Well, I'm an excavator.
translation.es: El Sr. Brown es arqueólogo. Hago excavaciones.

translation.en: - You've come to dig up the mounds? - Well…
I'm afraid not. Uh, not today.
Excuse me.
- Good luck with your gangsters, Robert. - Thank you.
And you, with your dig, ma'am.
Ah, blast.
- Mr. Brown? - Yes?
Billy Lyons. Uh, uh, from Mrs. Pretty.
translation.es: Soy Billy Lyons. La Sra. Pretty se la envía.

translation.en: All right.
Tell her Monday, 8:00 sharp.
translation.es: Dígale que el lunes. A las ocho en punto.

translation.en: I won't work for less than two pound a week.
translation.es: No aceptaré menos de dos libras.

translation.en: And it's too far to bike, if you want a day's digging.
translation.es: Es muy lejos en bicicleta para un día de excavación.

translation.en: You could lodge with the Lyonses in the coach house.
translation.es: Vivirá con los Lyons en la antigua cochera.

translation.en: Mr. Lyons is my chauffeur, and Mrs. Lyons is in charge of the kitchen.
translation.es: El Sr. Lyons es mi chofer y la Sra. Lyons se encarga de la cocina.

translation.en: - Well, I'll need help. - I could let you have one man.
translation.es: Necesitaré ayuda. Puede contratar a una persona.

translation.en: Two would be better.
I'm glad we could come to an arrangement after all, Mr. Brown.
translation.es: Me alegra que hayamos llegado a un acuerdo.

translation.en: John Jacobs and Mr. Spooner are bringing the shepherd's hut.
translation.es: John Jacobs y Spooner traerán la cabaña del pastor.

translation.en: I thought it might be useful in case of inclement weather. Oh, that's very considerate.
translation.es: - Puede ser útil si hay mal tiempo. - Qué considerada.

translation.en: My son Robert is keen to assist you in any way.
translation.es: Mi hijo Robert estaría feliz de ayudarlo en lo que quiera.

translation.en: If you find his presence irksome--
Oh, no, no, no. He can come.
You'll start with this one?
Yeah.
I reckon we can forget that larger mound, Mrs. Pretty.
translation.es: El túmulo grande no nos será útil.

translation.en: This one here, that's where we'll find something.
translation.es: Este es ideal. Aquí encontraremos algo.

translation.en: Well, shan't hold you up.
Thank you kindly.
If you ask me, the man should leave Mrs. Pretty's mounds well alone.
translation.es: Ese tipo no debería excavar los túmulos de la Sra. Pretty.

translation.en: - Thank you, ma'am. - Great, dear. Thank you.
Darling, please be gentle. You'll knock me down.
translation.es: Cariño, ten cuidado. Me vas a tumbar.

translation.en: I'm sorry. Mr. Brown says to come.
translation.es: Perdón. El Sr. Brown quiere que vayas.

translation.en: - Now? - Yes.
Well, thank you for the message.
Well, it looks like the kind of tray you get at a butcher's.
And there's some blackness here, maybe indicating a fire was made.
translation.es: Hay una capa negra que puede indicar que hubo una fogata.

translation.en: Who are those men?
They're from the Ipswich Museum. Mr. Reid Moir telephoned me.
translation.es: Son del Museo de Ipswich. El Sr. Reedmore me llamó.

translation.en: He wanted to see how things were progressing, so I invited him.
translation.es: Quería saber cómo iba todo, así que lo invité.

translation.en: Mrs. Pretty, this is Guy Maynard, our new curator.
translation.es: Sra. Pretty, le presento a Guy Maynard, nuestro curador nuevo.

translation.en: - How do you do? - Hello.
Hello, Brown.
Maynard. Can I borrow you, please, for this here corner?
translation.es: Maynard, ¿me da su opinión sobre esto?

translation.en: Jolly good.
One.
- You have it? Two. - Yeah.
- Three! Blast. -
Is that the sum of your labors?
Excuse me.
I must urge you, Mrs. Pretty, to support our Roman villa.
translation.es: Sra. Pretty, le ruego que apoye nuestra villa romana.

translation.en: War is looming. All hands are on deck to excavate before hostilities begin.
translation.es: La guerra se acerca. Todos debemos excavar antes de que comiencen las hostilidades.

translation.en: And so, we must ask you to return Mr. Brown.
translation.es: Por eso le pedimos que nos devuelva al Sr. Brown.

translation.en: I'd like him to finish what he's started.
translation.es: Quiero que termine lo que comenzó.

translation.en: We may have found the largest Roman villa north of Felixstowe.
translation.es: Quizá sea la villa romana más grande al norte de Felixstowe.

translation.en: It's of far greater import, if… if you'll forgive me, than this…
translation.es: Quizá sea la villa romana más grande al norte de Felixstowe. Con todo respeto, es mucho más importante

translation.en: minor venture.
- Then the choice is Mr. Brown's. - Excuse me.
Time had altered that piece of wood to compacted sand.
translation.es: El paso del tiempo transformó esa madera en arena compacta.

translation.en: I didn't guess its age correctly.
I speculated Viking, but I think that's older.
translation.es: Pensé que era vikinga, pero creo que es más antigua.

translation.en: - Anglo- Saxon. - That's most unlikely, Brown.
We should-- We need you back at the villa. That's what I'm here to say, and…
translation.es: - Anglosajona. - Es poco probable, Brown. Lo necesitamos en la villa. Vine a decírselo.

translation.en: and Mrs. Pretty has released you.
translation.es: Lo necesitamos en la villa. Vine a decírselo. La Sra. Pretty lo deja ir.

translation.en: I have said it is your choice.
Well, then I'll stay.
Thank you kindly, ma'am.
Excuse me.
Now, look here, Brown. You've made your point. You can have two pounds a week.
translation.es: Ya entendimos el mensaje. Le pagaremos dos libras a la semana.

translation.en: We'll give you a few days to finish off here,
translation.es: Le daremos unos días para terminar.

translation.en: and then, as we're the only museum in the area, I'd carefully consider where your future lies.
translation.es: Como somos el único museo del área, piense bien en su futuro.

translation.en: Understood.
Mr. Brown's been telling us all sorts of things.
translation.es: El Sr. Brown nos ha contado muchas cosas.

translation.en: For instance, what's the most important part of an archaeologist's body?
translation.es: Por ejemplo, ¿qué es lo más importante de un arqueólogo?

translation.en: - I don't know. -
His nose.
If there's something there, he'll know it by the smell.
translation.es: Si hay algo, lo sabrá por el olor.

translation.en: You're going to see your father this afternoon?
translation.es: Esta tarde visitarás a tu papá.

translation.en: I… I'm afraid I'm needed here.
- Um, please, may I get down? - If you're quite sure you've finished.
Boiled beef…
on a hot day like this is unlikely to agree with anyone, Mrs. Lyons.
translation.es: en un día como este no le hace bien a nadie, Sra. Lyons.

translation.en: It was exactly like last time.
Mrs. Pretty, you produce all this acid because you're a worrier.
translation.es: Sra. Pretty, produce ese ácido porque se preocupa mucho.

translation.en: We've spoken on this subject before.
- You must learn to stop worrying. -
translation.es: Debe aprender a dejar de preocuparse.

translation.en: Otherwise, you'll give yourself an ulcer.
translation.es: De lo contrario, le dará una úlcera.

translation.en: - Well… if that's what you think. - Mm- hmm.
translation.es: Bueno, si eso es lo que piensa.

translation.en: Oh, you don't wanna be down there, Mrs. Pretty. That ain't safe.
translation.es: No debería estar aquí. No es seguro.

translation.en: Spooner and John Jacobs are making supports. We can't continue without them now.
translation.es: Spooner y Jacobs construyen soportes. Los necesitamos para continuar.

translation.en: I was reading Howard Carter's account
translation.es: Leí el relato de Howard Carter

translation.en: of his excavation of the tomb of Tutankhamun.
translation.es: sobre la excavación de la tumba de Tutankamón.

translation.en: He stood at the threshold of the burial chamber,
translation.es: Se paró en el umbral de la cámara funeraria.

translation.en: the first man to do so for 3,000 years,
translation.es: Era el primero en estar ahí en 3000 años,

translation.en: and he saw finger marks still on the paint.
translation.es: y notó huellas digitales en la pintura.

translation.en: He say, Time lost its meaning.
translation.es: Dijo: El tiempo perdió su significado.

translation.en: It occurs to me that you might unearth human remains.
translation.es: Tal vez usted encuentre restos humanos.

translation.en: Yeah, that's possible.
We're digging down to meet the dead.
translation.es: Excavamos para conocer a los muertos.

translation.en: Disinterring them, in fact.
There's always coroner's inquests when remains are found.
translation.es: Si se hallan restos, hay una investigación forense.

translation.en: The dead still get that courtesy, no matter how many centuries they've lain.
translation.es: Los muertos reciben ese tratamiento sin importar cuántos siglos lleven ahí.

translation.en: We can't dig down into the earth without considering that--
translation.es: No podemos excavar la tierra sin tener en cuenta…

translation.en: Brown?
Mr. Brown?
Spooner! Jacob! Get help!
There! There! There!
Come on, Basil!
Careful with his head.
Mr. Brown! Mr. Brown! Mr. Brown!
Mr. Brown?
- That's it. - That's it.
- - Mr. Brown. Mr. Brown.
You're all right now. You're all right. You're all right.
You're all right.
Into the library, Grateley. Lay him on the sofa.
translation.es: Llévenlo a la biblioteca y acuéstenlo en el sofá.

translation.en: Did you see something?
See something?
When you were gone.
Something did come into my head.
What was it?
My, uh… my grandfather.
I have his name.
Farming man.
Taught me everything I know about Suffolk soil.
translation.es: Me enseñó lo que sé sobre el suelo de Suffolk.

translation.en: And you saw him?
Oh, I saw nothing at all. I was just…
I just thought of him.
Well… perhaps he saw you.
translation.es: Bueno… quizá él lo vio a usted.

translation.en: - Excuse me. - Mr. Brown, are you all right?
Mr. Brown!
Mr. Brown, you have to rest!
See, Mrs. Pretty… this one is the one you like.
translation.es: Sra. Pretty… Quería que comenzara por ese túmulo.

translation.en: It's the one you wanted me to start on. It's oval.
translation.es: Quería que comenzara por ese túmulo. Es ovalado.

translation.en: Like a hog's back.
- See? All the others, circular. - Yes.
Now, this land's been plowed for 1,000 year.
translation.es: - Sí. - Han arado esta tierra mil años.

translation.en: Now, supposing whoever plowed here…
translation.es: Digamos que quien la haya arado…

translation.en: gradually knocked a bit off.
So, by the time robbers come along,
they'd have sunk the flute into what they thought was the center.
translation.es: hicieron la chimenea en donde creían que estaba el centro.

translation.en: - But it might not have been. - That's right.
translation.es: - Tal vez no era el centro. - Así es.

translation.en: East to west, that's my feeling.
You say the word…
…and I'll dig.
My plane crashed into the Arctic waste, you see.
translation.es: Mi avión se estrelló en el ártico,

translation.en: And when I woke up, 500 years had passed.
translation.es: y cuando desperté, habían pasado 500 años.

translation.en: - So, now I'm stuck in the 25th century. - What's that like, then?
translation.es: Ahora estoy atascado en el siglo XXV. ¿Cómo es?

translation.en: Well, the Earth is controlled by Killer Kane, who's an extremely evil man.
translation.es: El despiadado Kane controla la Tierra.

translation.en: Like Hitler?
Yes, with an even worse mustache.
translation.es: Sí, pero su bigote es peor.

translation.en: Did the people who made these burial mounds have mustaches?
translation.es: ¿Los que hicieron estos túmulos tenían bigote?

translation.en: And beards.
They were a very beardy lot.
Not like them there Romans. Now, they liked the close shave.
translation.es: No como los romanos, a quienes les gustaba afeitarse.

translation.en: The Vikings and the space pilots are the same, really, aren't they?
translation.es: Los vikingos y los pilotos espaciales son iguales, ¿no?

translation.en: They explore new lands and have battles in ships.
translation.es: Exploran tierras nuevas y tienen batallas en naves.

translation.en: Yeah, when you put it like that, I suppose they might be the same.
translation.es: Al verlo de ese modo, supongo que sí son iguales.

translation.en: They come over all the time. There's an RAF base nearby.
translation.es: Sobrevuelan todo el tiempo. Hay una base aérea cerca.

translation.en: Would you like to fly, Mr. Brown?
Oh, but I do.
All over the cosmos, every time I look through my telescope.
translation.es: Por todo el cosmos. Cuando miro por mi telescopio.

translation.en: You… You have a telescope?
- I do. - Did you bring it with you?
I did.
Well, will you show me?
I might.
Cor! He likes to natter, he does.
What was all that about space travel?
translation.es: ¿A qué se refería con los viajes espaciales?

translation.en: Mr. Brown had an awful lot of books.
translation.es: El Sr. Brown tenía muchos libros.

translation.en: Came on his bike with a great parcel of them.
Sloan says some are in Norwegian.
translation.es: Según la Sra. Lyons, algunos son en noruego.

translation.en: Shall we try the green silk?
- It's an old favorite, isn't it? - No.
The velvet with the lace.
Mrs. Lyons hopes it will agree.
translation.es: La Sra. Lyons espera que le siente bien.

translation.en: How's your leg, Mr. Grateley?
Oh, much better, ma'am. Thank you for inquiring.
Would you like the wireless? - Yes, please. -
…the Air Guard under the age of 32
translation.es: …los guardias aéreos menores de 32 años deben estar listos

translation.en: are now being asked to stand by
translation.es: …los guardias aéreos menores de 32 años deben estar listos para entrenarse como pilotos o personal de la fuerza aérea.

translation.en: for further training as RAF pilots or crew.
translation.es: para entrenarse como pilotos o personal de la fuerza aérea.

translation.en: She's only been here 12 year.
- Mm- hmm. - Came down from Cheshire.
Then she married the colonel.
translation.es: Luego se casó con el coronel.

translation.en: He first met with Edith when she was still at school.
translation.es: Conoció a Edith en la escuela,

translation.en: And on his 17th birthday, he asked her to marry him.
translation.es: y cuando cumplió 17 años le pidió matrimonio.

translation.en: - She turned him down. - Mm.
She say she can't possibly leave her father.
translation.es: Dijo que no podía dejar a su padre.

translation.en: She cared for her father another 13 year, until he died.
translation.es: Cuidó a su padre otros 13 años hasta que falleció.

translation.en: After 13 years.
She finally accepted the colonel's proposal.
translation.es: Finalmente, aceptó la propuesta del coronel.

translation.en: He been asking every year on her birthday.  On her birthday.
translation.es: Le pedía matrimonio en cada cumpleaños.

translation.en: Just after they had Robert…
translation.es: Después de que tuvieron a Robert,

translation.en: her husband went and died too.
Imagine that.
Do any of you want to look through this?
- I thought we'd sit down on that. - You have a go.
translation.es: - Pensé que debía sentarme allí. - Mire.

translation.en: That's right.
- I'm gonna follow you back home. -
translation.es: Lo observaré de regreso a casa.

translation.en: Wait! Wait, for Christ's sake!
Come on.
Maynard! Maynard!
They found an iron rivet at the burial mound at Snape, didn't they?
translation.es: Hallaron un roblón de hierro en el túmulo funerario en Snape, ¿no?

translation.en: Snape? Basil, what have you found?
My goodness, Basil.
- Right. Any joy, Basil? - Coming along together.
Mr. Spooner, will you bring my tape measure from the hut?
translation.es: ¿Me pasa la cinta métrica de la cabaña?

translation.en: One of you best get Mrs. Pretty down here.
translation.es: Alguien vaya por la Sra. Pretty.

translation.en: - She's gone up to London. - She what? How long?
London, with Robert. Couple of days.
translation.es: Fue a Londres con Robert un par de días.

translation.en: Blast.
Right, boys. Here we go. Come on together.
Better have something to show Mrs. Pretty when she get back.
- - And the crystal glasses!
No, no, no. Side door, please.
- Mrs. Pretty back from London yet? - Mrs. Pretty's about to dine.
translation.es: - ¿Ya regresó la Sra. Pretty? - Está por cenar.

translation.en: I told you it was urgent.
Mr. Brown, I'm sure you wouldn't like to interfere with--
It's all right, Mr. Grateley.
- Is it Mr. Brown? - Yes, darling. Darling
translation.es: - ¿Es el Sr. Brown? - Sí. Calma, cariño.

translation.en: I think you'd better come and see.
That's a ship.
How do you mean, a ship?
Oh, well, that's a ship that's been buried in the mound.
translation.es: Es un barco enterrado en el túmulo.

translation.en: Why would anyone want to bury a ship?
Well, I expect because that's a grave.
translation.es: Supongo que porque es una tumba.

translation.en: Whose grave?
Well, I'd expect this is a grave of a… a great man.
A warrior…
or a king.
They must have pulled his ship all the way up that there hill from the river.
translation.es: Debieron haberlo cargado por esa colina desde el río.

translation.en: Now, they'd have put it on ropes, and they'd have hauled it over logs.
translation.es: Seguro usaron cuerdas y la transportaron sobre troncos.

translation.en: Men, horses. It must have taken hundreds of 'em.
translation.es: Debieron usar cientos de hombres y caballos.

translation.en: I don't expect them to go to all this trouble for any little squirt.
translation.es: No se habrían molestado tanto por un don nadie.

translation.en: Can you imagine the send- off they'd be giving him?
The songs they'd be singing.
They'd have drunk Mr. Spooner under the table.
translation.es: Habrían bebido más que el Sr. Spooner.

translation.en: - - Vikings?
Well, I… I think that's older.
Maynard disagrees, but I think it's Anglo- Saxon.
translation.es: Maynard no está de acuerdo, pero creo que es anglosajón.

translation.en: Now, this is your doing, John Jacobs, 'cause you found the first rivet.
translation.es: John Jacobs, usted encontró el primer roblón.

translation.en: - - That's right, Mrs. Pretty. He did.
Congratulations, Mr. Brown.
Well, you thought there was something, didn't you? I had my feeling.
translation.es: - Usted creía que hallaríamos algo. - Lo presentía.

translation.en: That you did, Mrs. Pretty. That you did.
Oh, John. - Congratulations, Mr. Spooner. - Thank you, ma'am.
We couldn't have done it without this young man here.
translation.es: No lo habríamos logrado sin este jovencito.

translation.en: Robert, a ship!
Thank you. Mr. Brown.
Well, there's a lot of earth to… to shift now.
But who knows?
I'm pretty sure it continues further.
translation.es: Estoy seguro de que es más grande.

translation.en: Evening.
Evening.
Do you realize what this means?
It's going to change everything for Ipswich.
We'll be the envy of every museum in the country.
translation.es: Seremos la envidia de los museos del país.

translation.en: - You're gonna get wet, Mrs. Pretty. - I'm afraid I already am.
translation.es: - Se va a mojar, Sra. Pretty. - Ya me mojé.

translation.en: Mr. Reid Moir has kindly offered to take charge of the dig.
translation.es: El Sr. Reedmore ofreció encargarse de la excavación.

translation.en: I turned his generous offer down.
- You didn't. - I did.
What did he say?
He said I couldn't keep it to myself, which is true.
translation.es: Dijo que no me lo podía quedar, lo cual es cierto.

translation.en: I bet he blew his gasket.
In the meantime, I've asked my cousin, Rory Lomax, to come.
translation.es: Le pedí a mi primo, Rory Lomax, que viniera.

translation.en: - Right. - I can see you need another pair of hands.
translation.es: - Bien. - Veo que necesita otro ayudante.

translation.en: He's only an amateur, but then, so is Mr. Reid Moir.
translation.es: Es un principiante, como el Sr. Reedmore.

translation.en: - Mrs. Pretty, you better go in the shed. - Oh, yes.
translation.es: - Debería resguardarse en la cabaña… - Está bien.

translation.en: - You're gonna get very wet here. - I will.
translation.es: - Debería resguardarse en la cabaña… - Está bien. …porque se va a empapar aquí afuera.

translation.en: I wanted to thank you for your patience with Robert.
translation.es: Quería agradecerle su paciencia con Robert.

translation.en: He can hardly wait to see you in the mornings.  Well, keeps me on me toes, having him around.
translation.es: - Anhela mucho verlo en las mañanas. - Me mantiene alerta.

translation.en: Do you have children?
No, uh, we, uh…
The servants tell me you've studied everything, from Latin to geology.
translation.es: Los sirvientes dicen que estudió de todo, desde latín hasta geología.

translation.en: Well, a little education is a dangerous thing.
Hmm. Apparently, you've written a book.  I have.
translation.es: - Al parecer, escribió un libro. - Correcto.

translation.en: A guide to astronomical maps and charts,
translation.es: Una guía de mapas y cuadros astronómicos

translation.en: to make them accessible to ordinary men.
translation.es: para que la gente común los entienda.

translation.en: I left school when I was 12. Always had a hunger to study.
translation.es: Me retiré del colegio a los 12 años. Siempre quise estudiar.

translation.en: I got a place at London University.
translation.es: Me aceptaron en la Universidad de Londres.

translation.en: My father wouldn't hear of it.
translation.es: Mi padre no estuvo de acuerdo.

translation.en: Would you have dinner with me?
Well… thank you. Yes.
Evening, Vera.
Surprise for you, Basil, in your room.
translation.es: Hay una sorpresa en la habitación.

translation.en: Right.
I brought you some fresh shirts.
- - About time, I say.
- Are you pleased to see me? - Of course I am.
- You didn't know I was coming, did you? - No. No, I didn't.
translation.es: - No sabías que venía, ¿no? - Para nada.

translation.en: I did tell you.
In my last letter.
Oh, I was saving them for the weekend.
translation.es: Las iba a leer el fin de semana.

translation.en: I've been working every hour. You know what I'm like.
translation.es: No he parado de trabajar. Ya me conoces.

translation.en: Yes… I do.
I'm very busy.
- It looks like it. Nowhere to sit in here. - There's a lot going on here.
translation.es: - Eso parece. No hay donde sentarse. - Hay mucho que hacer.

translation.en: - What's that? - I said there's nowhere to sit down.
Yeah. Sorry about that. It's all-- So much going on.
You got something to show me? I think you have. I can see it in your eyes.
translation.es: ¿Tienes algo que mostrarme? Se te nota en los ojos.

translation.en: I'm not saying anything.
There's Mr. Brown with a woman.
translation.es: Es el Sr. Brown con una mujer.

translation.en: I suppose it's his wife. You know, she writes to him every day.
translation.es: Ha de ser su mujer. Ella le escribe todos los días.

translation.en: Come in.
Mr. Brown sends his apologies, ma'am.
That's all. Thank you, Ellen.
A man could dig the earth his whole life through
translation.es: Alguien puede excavar toda su vida

translation.en: and not find anything like I've discovered here.
translation.es: sin encontrar lo que yo encontré aquí.

translation.en: - She's beautiful, all right. - Yeah, she's beautiful.
translation.es: - Es un barco hermoso. - Así es.

translation.en: You'll have to watch your back with a thing like this.
translation.es: Debes tener cuidado con este hallazgo.

translation.en: What do you mean?
Everyone's gonna want a piece of this here ship, and this is your find.
translation.es: Todos querrán aprovecharse de tu hallazgo.

translation.en: Oh, May…  Don't let Ipswich Museum take your glory.
translation.es: - May. - Que el museo no se lleve tu gloria.

translation.en: - He's not gonna take-- - Or that lady at the manor.
translation.es: - No va a… - O la señora de la casona.

translation.en: - She should be upping your wages again. - She's supportive.
translation.es: - Debería subirte el sueldo. - Me ha apoyado…

translation.en: - You asked? - I ain't gonna ask for more.
translation.es: No voy a pedir más dinero.

translation.en: Well, she's very, very gracious, Mrs. Pretty.
translation.es: La Sra. Pretty es muy gentil.

translation.en: Your heart's lost to this Viking maiden, I can tell.
translation.es: Se nota que te enamoraste de esta belleza vikinga.

translation.en: Ah, May, you sure you don't want to stay the night?
I'll miss my lift back.
Right, yeah, um…
Well, thanks for coming, May.
I do miss you.
- I've been reading your books for company. - You haven't.
translation.es: - Leo tus libros para no sentirme sola. - ¿De verdad?

translation.en: - I have. -  Hell, it's not much company, is it?
translation.es: - Sí. - No evitan que estés sola.

translation.en: - No, they're hard work, I tell you. - They are.
translation.es: - No, son muy complejos. - Así es.

translation.en: Right. Well, it's good of you to bring my shirts.
translation.es: - Gracias por traerme mis camisas. - Claro.

translation.en: All right.
I'll read them letters tonight.
- Bye, then. - Bye.
Blast!
- Let me help. - Right.
Right, then. Get around that side and take this tarp.
translation.es: Bueno, vaya al otro lado y extienda la lona.

translation.en: That's… That's right. That's right. There's a stake there behind you.
translation.es: Eso es. Use la estaca que tiene detrás.

translation.en: Pull it hard.
Where in God's name did you come from?
I rode, actually, on my motorbike from Ipswich.
I'm Rory Lomax.
Aye. Did Reid Moir send you?
- From the museum? -
I'm Edith Pretty's cousin.
translation.es: Soy el primo de Edith Pretty.

translation.en: She telephoned, asked me to come. - Said you needed an extra pair of hands. - All right.
translation.es: Me pidió que viniera. Dijo que necesitaba un ayudante.

translation.en: I pointed out my general lack of skill, but she was undeterred.
translation.es: Le dije que no sé qué hacer, pero no le importó.

translation.en: Right. Well…
no doubt you'll hear that my name is Brown. Basil Brown.
translation.es: Ya sabrá que me llamo Brown. - Basil Brown. - Mucho gusto.

translation.en: Good to meet you.
Now, it's gonna be raining for a while, so go on and take a seat.
translation.es: No va a parar de llover en un buen rato, así que siéntese.

translation.en: I expect you'd, uh, be wet, coming from Ipswich on a motorbike.
translation.es: Supongo que se mojó al venir de Ipswich en moto.

translation.en: - I was, rather. - Yeah.
translation.es: Me empapé. Comenzó a llover cuando ya casi llegaba.

translation.en: - Just caught me at the end. - Right.
translation.es: Me empapé. Comenzó a llover cuando ya casi llegaba. Bueno, voy a prender la estufa. ¿Quiere tomar té?

translation.en: Well, I'll light the stove. Would you like some tea?
translation.es: Bueno, voy a prender la estufa. ¿Quiere tomar té?

translation.en: Yes, please.
I think we may have found, um, an old, uh, Anglo- Saxon ship.
translation.es: Creo que hallamos un barco anglosajón.

translation.en: When this rain clears tomorrow, maybe you can see what we're doing.
translation.es: Cuando pare de llover mañana, puede ver lo que hacemos aquí.

translation.en: - Yeah? - How very exciting.
Yeah, it's all right.
- Not gonna cover it. - Get the second tarp.
translation.es: No la cubriré hasta tener la otra lona.

translation.en: - Pass me the hammer, please. - Right.
All right, then.
Lift up.
- - That's right.
Rory!
Hello, Spud.
Arrived in the night. Didn't want to wake you. Where's your mother?
translation.es: Llegué en la noche. ¿Dónde está tu mamá?

translation.en: - - Oh, she's gone to London.
Who knows if we'll still be alive in a year?
translation.es: Quién sabe si estaremos vivos en un año.

translation.en: The yellow and green balls denote gas.
translation.es: Las pelotas amarillas y verdes indican la presencia de gas.

translation.en: - Red denotes high explosives. -
translation.es: Las rojas indican que hay explosivos.

translation.en: Red stripes are incendiary bombs.
translation.es: Las de franjas rojas son bombas incendiarias.

translation.en: If you are caught on the streets during an air raid,
translation.es: Si están en la calle y hay un bombardeo,

translation.en: you must know the appropriate response to each form of attack.
translation.es: deben saber cómo responder a cada tipo de ataque.

translation.en: No, don't throw them about!
I was rushing to get here on time.
translation.es: Me apresuré para llegar a tiempo.

translation.en: Might that have affected the results?
Possibly, but the, uh, underlying condition is there.
translation.es: Sí, pero de todas maneras, está enferma.

translation.en: The rheumatic fever you had as a child, it, uh,
translation.es: La fiebre reumática que tuvo de niña

translation.en: damaged the valves of your heart.
Irreparably, I'm afraid.
Another attack is likely to be much… more serious.
translation.es: Si sufre otro ataque, será mucho más grave.

translation.en: Possibly even fatal.
- Is there nothing else that can be done? - I'm sorry. I… I… I wish I had better news.
translation.es: - ¿No se puede hacer nada más? - Ojalá pudiera darle mejores noticias.

translation.en: Mr. Reid Moir is here, ma'am, with some other gentlemen.
translation.es: El Sr. Reedmore vino con otros señores.

translation.en: They wouldn't stop to give me their names. Then they're trespassing. Where are they?
translation.es: - No se detuvieron. - Entraron sin autorización. ¿Dónde están?

translation.en: - On their way to the mounds. - Fetch them, quickly.
translation.es: - Van hacia los túmulos. - Vaya por ellos.

translation.en: - Right. - Lyons?
translation.es: - Van hacia los túmulos. - Vaya por ellos. ¿Lyons?

translation.en: Now, I've been reading up about the Oseberg Ship.
translation.es: Leí sobre el barco de Oseberg.

translation.en: That's a Viking ship they found in Norway.
translation.es: Es un barco vikingo que hallaron en Noruega.

translation.en: There was a burial chamber in the center, roofed.
translation.es: En el centro, tenía una cámara funeraria Techada.

translation.en: It's a bit like we imagine Noah's Ark.
translation.es: Como nos imaginamos el Arca de Noé.

translation.en: Course, any roof here would have caved in long ago.
translation.es: Si hubiera habido techo aquí, se habría derrumbado.

translation.en: See, this line here. The ground is higher, but this soil is darker.
translation.es: En esta línea, el suelo está más arriba, pero la tierra es más oscura.

translation.en: So you think there's something beneath?
Well, we may know by the end of today.
translation.es: Tal vez sepamos al final del día.

translation.en: Ye gods!
This is incredible!
We at the Ipswich Museum pride ourselves on our work,
translation.es: En el Museo de Ipswich nos enorgullece nuestro trabajo.

translation.en: and I… I think you'll agree that it's rock solid.
translation.es: Estará de acuerdo en la calidad.

translation.en: - You… You need to stop there. - I beg your pardon?
This is a very delicate site, and it ain't safe. Uh, not for a man of your size.
translation.es: La excavación no es segura para alguien de su tamaño.

translation.en: Is this your work?
Uh, yes. I'm Basil Brown, excavator.
translation.es: Sí, soy Basil Brown, el excavador.

translation.en: Well, Basil Brown, excavator…
I am Charles Phillips, archaeologist,
and I'm here to tell you that, as this is a find of national interest,
translation.es: Vine a informarle que este hallazgo es de interés nacional,

translation.en: the British Museum will be taking charge.
translation.es: y el Museo Británico se hará cargo.

translation.en: Your work…
looks, thankfully, decent,
but your excavating service is no longer required.
translation.es: pero ya no necesitamos sus servicios de excavador.

translation.en: Am… Am I to understand that you will be personally taking over?
translation.es: ¿Es decir que usted mismo se hará cargo?

translation.en: Grimes, I have never seen anything like it.
translation.es: Grimes, jamás había visto algo así.

translation.en: - Quite, sir. - Brailesford. - Sir. - Cancel everything I've got.
translation.es: - Así es. - Brailsford, cancele mis compromisos.

translation.en: Find out who's free. We need Piggott.
translation.es: Averigüe quién está disponible. Quiero a Piggott.

translation.en: - Find us lodgings, as near as you can. - Yes, sir.
That dark soil in the middle, C.W., looks very promising.
translation.es: La tierra más oscura se ve prometedora.

translation.en: You men, finish up, and don't move another pebble!
translation.es: Ustedes ya pueden terminar. No muevan ni una piedra más.

translation.en: Excuse me, Mr. Phillips.
I'm not employed by you.
I'm employed by Mrs. Pretty, and I'll keep on working until she tells me different.
translation.es: Trabajo para la Sra. Pretty y no pararé si no me lo ordena ella.

translation.en: An ad hoc team from a provincial museum cannot be left in charge.
translation.es: Un equipo de un museo provinciano no puede estar a cargo.

translation.en: Mrs. Pretty must see that.
John, a minute is all I need. I… I know she'll want to hear this.
translation.es: John, solo necesito un minuto. Ella querrá oír esto.

translation.en: - All right, all right. Wait here. - Right.
She'll see you tomorrow morning at 10:30. She must know what I found.
translation.es: - Lo verá mañana a las 10:30. - Debe saber qué hallé.

translation.en: - Don't push it, old boy! - She must know!
- - John!
- Is he gone, Mr. Grateley? - It's not Grateley.
translation.es: ¿Se fue, Sr. Grateley? No soy Grateley.

translation.en: I… I'm sorry for disturbing you, but I believe…
we may have found a burial chamber in the ship.
translation.es: que encontramos una cámara funeraria en el barco.

translation.en: - Does Mr. Phillips know? - I don't work for Mr. Phillips.
translation.es: - ¿El Sr. Phillips lo sabe? - No trabajo para él.

translation.en: What are your wishes?
I, uh… He just informed me that, by order of the Ministry of Works,
translation.es: Me informó que el Ministerio del Trabajo

translation.en: the site must be placed under his control.
translation.es: le dio el control de la excavación.

translation.en: Well, uh…
…that's that, then.
Well, I… I can carry on for one more day… if that's what you'd like.
translation.es: Puedo trabajar un día más si eso quiere usted.

translation.en: Are… Are you poorly, Mrs. Pretty?
Perhaps you might, um…
might ring the bell for me.
Right.
He's got no right to dictate to you. This ship's only appearing because of you.
translation.es: No tiene derecho de darle órdenes. Hallamos el barco por usted.

translation.en: Don't forget why you wanted it begun.
translation.es: No olvide por qué quería empezar.

translation.en: Now, you said that was a feeling.
Your feeling is right.
- Mr. Brown seems to have found his way in. - Mr. Brown.
translation.es: - El Sr. Brown se las ingenió para entrar. - Sr. Brown.

translation.en: All right.
Is there anything I could bring you? Fetch Ellen for me, please.
translation.es: - ¿Se le ofrece algo? - Busque a Ellen, por favor.

translation.en: Mrs. Pretty is keen to keep you on,
translation.es: La Sra. Pretty quiere que continúen,

translation.en: so we'll make good use of you.
translation.es: así que les daremos ciertas labores.

translation.en: Your primary task will be to keep the site in order.
translation.es: Su tarea principal será mantener todo en orden.

translation.en: So, I want the tumulus dug back to an area of four feet on either side,
translation.es: Quiero que excaven 1.20 metros a cada lado del túmulo

translation.en: and I want those spoil heaps removed.
translation.es: y que retiren el material de desecho.

translation.en: From now on, you're not to set foot in the body of the ship without my express permission.
translation.es: De ahora en adelante, no pisarán el barco sin mi autorización.

translation.en: Carry on.
Are you gonna put up with that, Basil?
Hello, Mr. Brown.
- My mother's got her heartburn. - Oh, I'm sorry to hear that.
translation.es: - Mi mamá tiene acidez estomacal. - Lo lamento.

translation.en: She has to have peace and quiet. I made her this.
translation.es: Necesita paz y tranquilidad. Le hice esto.

translation.en: - Well, that's a very fine rocket. - Where are you going?
translation.es: Es un cohete genial. ¿A dónde va?

translation.en: Oh, I… Oh, I have to go home now.
When will you be back?
Well, uh… I'm sorry, Robert. I…
I am.
Uh, but, Mr. Brown…
Mr. Brown!
- Mr. Brown! - It seems I'm out of a job.
Phillips won't let us in his ship.
translation.es: Phillips no nos deja estar en su barco.

translation.en: His ship? Really?
translation.es: ¿De verdad cree que es de él?

translation.en: I thought I might take some photographs. It could make a useful record.
translation.es: Voy a tomar fotos para que haya un registro. ¿Te importa?

translation.en: - Would you mind? - Not at all.
translation.es: Voy a tomar fotos para que haya un registro. ¿Te importa? Para nada, si no me las tomas a mí.

translation.en: - As long as they're not of me. -
translation.es: Para nada, si no me las tomas a mí.

translation.en: Can't say I blame Brown.
Such a decent man doesn't deserve Phillips.
translation.es: Un tipo tan decente no merece trabajar con Phillips.

translation.en: Blame him? Well, he left this morning. Didn't you know?
Where's Robert?
You don't have another job?
I'll write to Maynard, and he'll give me something.
translation.es: Le escribiré a Maynard. Me dará algo.

translation.en: Did you tell Mrs. Pretty you were leaving?
translation.es: ¿Le dijiste a la Sra. Pretty que renunciabas?

translation.en: I thought I'd let her work it out herself.
translation.es: Dejé que se enterara por su cuenta.

translation.en: And that's the thanks she gets for giving you the opportunity in the first place?
translation.es: ¿Así le agradeces que te diera la oportunidad?

translation.en: Mark my words, May, I won't receive any credit.
translation.es: Te lo aseguro, no me darán ningún crédito.

translation.en: - I won't even be a footnote. - Is that why you took the job?
translation.es: - No me mencionarán. - ¿Aceptaste el trabajo para eso?

translation.en: - For credit? - How can I stay on?
Is that why you've been digging your whole life for barely enough to cover our rent?
translation.es: ¿Por eso excavaste toda la vida sin mucha remuneración?

translation.en: No, May. I do it 'cause I'm good at it.
translation.es: May, excavo porque soy bueno en eso.

translation.en: 'Cause that's what my father taught me, and what his father taught him.
translation.es: Es lo que mi padre me enseñó. Y a él, su padre.

translation.en: 'Cause you can show me a handful of soil from anywhere in Suffolk,
translation.es: Si me muestras un puñado de tierra de Suffolk,

translation.en: and I can pretty much tell you whose land it's from.
translation.es: te diré de qué parte es exactamente.

translation.en: There you go.
Excuse me. Do you know Basil Brown?
- Do you know where he lives? - Yes, I know Basil.
He lives on a farm outside of the village. Carry on that way.
translation.es: Vive a las afueras. Ve por allá.

translation.en: Thank you so much.
I found that ship.
I may not be a fellow at Cambridge, but I worked out what was down there.
translation.es: No soy profesor de Cambridge, pero descubrí qué había ahí.

translation.en: And Jacobs and Spooner, too, and nobody'll remember that.
translation.es: Con Jacobs y Spooner, y nadie lo recordará.

translation.en: You don't know that.
And if you're not around to see it to the end, there's even less chance.
translation.es: Si no trabajas hasta el final, habrá menos oportunidad.

translation.en: You always told me your work isn't about the past or even the present.
translation.es: Tu trabajo no es sobre el pasado ni el presente,

translation.en: It's for the future.
So that the next generations can know where they came from.
translation.es: para que las próximas generaciones sepan de dónde vienen.

translation.en: The line that joins them to their forebears. Isn't that what you always say?
translation.es: Lo que las relaciona con sus ancestros. ¿No dices eso siempre?

translation.en: Yeah, something like that.
Why else would the lot of you be playing in the dirt
while the rest of the country prepares for war?
translation.es: mientras el país se prepara para la guerra?

translation.en: - Because that means something, innit? -
Something that'll last longer than whatever damn war we're heading into.
translation.es: Algo que perdurará más que la guerra que libraremos.

translation.en: Good hell.
That's Robert.
- Robert? -
- - Robert!
Mr. Brown!
Robert, have you cycled all this way?
You promised.
May! May!
You said you'd show me the cosmos. You promised.
translation.es: Me prometió que me mostraría el cosmos.

translation.en: - Good heavens! Who have we here? - This is Robert Pretty.
translation.es: - ¿Quién es este jovencito? - Es Robert Pretty.

translation.en: Robert, I'm Mrs. Brown.
I bet you have a rare thirst after that long ride, don't you?
translation.es: Debes tener sed después de ese viaje en bicicleta.

translation.en: - Mm- hmm. - Come you here.
translation.es: Debes tener sed después de ese viaje en bicicleta. Ven.

translation.en: - Let's get you a cup of milk. - That's a long way.
translation.es: - Ven a tomar leche. - Es muy lejos.

translation.en: Does your mother know you're here, Robert?
- How'd you find your way? - She know you cycled?
- Should I take your bike for you? - Yes, please.
translation.es: - Te ayudo con la bicicleta. - Tenemos jamón.

translation.en: I better find a telephone, May. Call Mrs. Pretty.
translation.es: Voy a llamar a la Sra. Pretty.

translation.en: - Thank you. - He's all right.
translation.es: - Gracias. - Está bien, Sra. Pretty. Está adentro.

translation.en: - He's inside. Uh, come this way. - Thank you.
translation.es: - Gracias. - Está bien, Sra. Pretty. Está adentro. - Por aquí. - Gracias.

translation.en: - We were obviously very worried. - Yes. He's… He's… Uh, this is May, my wife.
translation.es: - Estábamos preocupados. - Sí… Le presento a May, mi esposa.

translation.en: - Mrs. Pretty. - Thank you very much.
translation.es: - Ella es la Sra. Pretty. - Gracias.

translation.en: He's been no trouble. A lovely boy.
translation.es: Se portó bien. Es un niño adorable.

translation.en: Mrs. Brown has a music box from Whitby covered in all manner of shells.
translation.es: La Sra. Brown tiene una caja musical cubierta de conchas.

translation.en: Would you like to see?
Uh, no. We've imposed on your kindness enough.
translation.es: ¿Quieres verla? No, ya los molestamos lo suficiente.

translation.en: What were you thinking?
You could have been lost or killed.
translation.es: Podrías haberte perdido o incluso morir.

translation.en: - Robert… what were you thinking? - I'm sorry, Mother.
Uh, Robert came to remind me of a promise that I made.
translation.es: Robert vino a recordarme mi promesa.

translation.en: I said I'd show him the stars through my telescope.
translation.es: De mostrarle las estrellas con mi telescopio.

translation.en: Didn't I?
Then you're returning?
I am. Yes.
Thank you.
Morning!
Morning.
Mr. Grimes. I've been, uh… taking notes.
- Ah! - If they be of any use.
Why, they'd save me days.
- You must have suspected what was here. - Well, you've made good progress.
translation.es: - Debió sospechar qué había aquí. - Avanzaron.

translation.en: As did you.
Thank you kindly.
- It's fine work, Mr. Brown. - Yeah. Well, we made a start.
translation.es: Buen trabajo, Sr. Brown. Fue solo el comienzo.

translation.en: - Phillips. - Our excavator has returned.
Morning.
There's a sign in the bottom of the ship that there could be an intact chamber.
translation.es: En el casco hay indicios de que puede haber una cámara intacta.

translation.en: Tremendously exciting.
What about events in the wider world, C.W.?
translation.es: ¿Y lo que pasa en el mundo?

translation.en: How do you think it will affect us?
Judging by last night's news…
translation.es: A juzgar por las noticias de anoche,

translation.en: I think we could be at war in a matter of weeks,
translation.es: estaremos en guerra en unas semanas.

translation.en: and every excavation in the land will stop.
- So, it's up to us.  -
- Oh, good lord.  - Gosh.
- Jim! Billy Grimes! - Stuart!
- How the devil are you? - Very well.
translation.es: - ¡Stuart! - ¿Cómo estás? Muy bien. Ella es Margaret, mi esposa.

translation.en: - This is my wife, Margaret. - Peggy.
translation.es: Muy bien. Ella es Margaret, mi esposa. - Me dicen Peggy. - Mucho gusto, Sra. Piggott.

translation.en: Mrs. Piggott, a pleasure to meet you.
translation.es: - Me dicen Peggy. - Mucho gusto, Sra. Piggott.

translation.en: Mr. Phillips, I-- um, I wanted to say how pleased I was
translation.es: Sr. Phillips, quería decirle que me dio mucho gusto que me pidiera venir.

translation.en: that you specifically asked for me to come.
translation.es: que me dio mucho gusto que me pidiera venir.

translation.en: I know Stuart sent you my paper on Bosnian Lake villagers.
translation.es: Stuart le envió mi artículo sobre los lagos bosnios.

translation.en: It was awfully good of you to read it.
Ah, yes. Um, very stimulating.
I hope I'll be able to repay your faith in me.  I have no doubt.
translation.es: - Ojalá pueda pagarle su fe en mí. - Sin duda.

translation.en: It's just that I haven't done much actual fieldwork yet.
translation.es: No he hecho mucho trabajo de campo.

translation.en: Uh, so I wouldn't want you to think I'm more experienced than I really am.
Ah, you have all the key attributes.
Do I?
- This ship is very delicate. - Mm- hmm.
One could say, it, um, scarcely exists at all.
Too much weight, it disintegrates.
translation.es: Se desintegrará con mucho peso encima.

translation.en: You're probably less than nine stone, so I'll supervise from here
translation.es: Usted debe pesar menos de 57 kilos. Supervisaré desde aquí mientras los más ligeros excavan.

translation.en: while you light things get on with the digging.
translation.es: Supervisaré desde aquí mientras los más ligeros excavan.

translation.en: Am I to understand you only asked for me because of my size?
Uh, lucky guess, actually.
Yeah, thank God Piggott didn't marry a piglet.
translation.es: Menos mal Piggott no se casó con una gorda.

translation.en: Carry on!
- How does it look to you? - Sir?
What have you got there?
All right, then.
- First round's on me, chaps! - Very nice of you.
translation.es: - Invito la primera ronda. - Qué amable.

translation.en: Do they not have a… a double?
Sorry, darling, no. This is fine, though, isn't it?
We don't… We don't want to start by making a fuss.
Oh, no. Of course not.
We're so lucky to be part of this.
translation.es: Qué suerte estar en este proyecto.

translation.en: Yes.
- Yes, it's going to be amazing. - Mm.
Would you prefer this bed…
or… or… or that one?
I'll… I'll take this one, shall I?
You need to find a star and identify its direction of travel.
translation.es: Encuentra una estrella e identifica la dirección en la que viaja.

translation.en: - Good evening, gentlemen. - Good evening, Mrs. Pretty.
translation.es: - Buenas noches. - Buenas noches, Sra. Pretty.

translation.en: - Hello, Mother. - Hello, darling.
Do space pilots navigate using the stars?
translation.es: ¿Los pilotos espaciales navegan con las estrellas?

translation.en: Oh, most certainly, they do.
Ten more minutes, Commander. Then, bed.
translation.es: Comandante, diez minutos más, y a la cama.

translation.en: I see a star.
- Oh, God! - What's going on?
- It just gave way. - Get her off there!
- Piggott, get her off! - Oh, I'm so sorry!
translation.es: Piggott, sácala. Lo siento. No fue mi intención.

translation.en: - I didn't mean to damage anything. - Oh, you…
translation.es: Lo siento. No fue mi intención.

translation.en: - What you got, Brailesford? - You all right?
Sort of rusted lumps.  Come on, man. Where's your training?
translation.es: - Un puñado de tierra con óxido. - Recuerde su formación.

translation.en: Uh, an amorphous mass of corroded objects, sir.
translation.es: Una masa amorfa de objetos corroídos.

translation.en: You, get your camera down there. Photograph it.
translation.es: Tómele una foto con su cámara.

translation.en: That's… That's very hot in the full sun.
translation.es: Hace mucho calor en el sol.

translation.en: Oh, I'm fine. Thank you.
Watch your step there. This could well be our chamber.
translation.es: Cuidado ahí. Puede ser la cámara.

translation.en: Some barley water, Mrs. Piggott?
- Thank you. So clumsy. - Oh, not at all.
translation.es: - Gracias. Qué torpe soy. - Para nada.

translation.en: - That's a very lovely skirt. - Oh.
Completely useless. I don't have anything more suitable.
translation.es: No es práctica. No tenía nada más apropiado.

translation.en: - We came straight from our holiday. - Did you really?
- Yes. - Well, come to the house.
Let's see what we can find.
Is Mrs. Pretty still poorly?
She says she's perfectly fine, but…
…that's typical of her.
Damn this weather.
Losing a whole day.
So little time before world events…
translation.es: Queda poco tiempo antes de que se desate la guerra…

translation.en: confound us.
It's a race, an absolute race.
Then you are wasting the talents of Mr. Brown.
translation.es: Desperdicia el talento del Sr. Brown.

translation.en: Well, that's an excellent idea.
Stuart couldn't fault his work. Could he not be unearthing the stern?
translation.es: Según Stuart, trabaja bien. ¿Por qué no desentierra la popa?

translation.en: Mr. Brown isn't qualified.
translation.es: El Sr. Brown no está capacitado.

translation.en: Well, that's just snobbery, isn't it, Mr. Phillips?
- Brown! -
Brown!
Brown, come here, man!
Oh my God, Margaret.
Sorry. I forgot to lock the door.
No, you see, we… we… we share that bathroom
translation.es: Compartimos el baño con cuatro habitaciones más.

translation.en: with… with four other rooms, and, you know, I could have been anyone.
translation.es: Compartimos el baño con cuatro habitaciones más. Alguien más podría haber entrado. Por ejemplo, Grimes o Phillips.

translation.en: - Um, I could've been Grimes or Phillips. -
translation.es: Alguien más podría haber entrado. Por ejemplo, Grimes o Phillips.

translation.en: But you're not. You're my husband.
Yes, but how… how do you think I'd feel if… if one of them saw you in that state?
translation.es: ¿Cómo crees que me sentiría si alguien más te viera así?

translation.en: Oh! In what state?
In this state?
Christ, I-- Stop. You should be more careful. It's…
You know, now, after… after waiting eons, I shall… I shall go and have my bath.
translation.es: Después de esperar tanto, mejor voy a bañarme.

translation.en: - Mr. Spooner. - Right.
- Morning, Mr. Piggott. - C.W.
translation.es: - Buenos días, Sr. Piggott. - C. W.

translation.en: - You might have woken me. - I didn't like to.
You made me appear late.
Careful, Stuart. You've got a delicate line now, man.
translation.es: Cuidado, Stuart. Es una línea delicada.

translation.en: - Very delicate. - You ready?
- Yeah. - Just a moment.
You have to be very careful now. No cavalier lifting.
translation.es: Con cuidado. No lo levanten bruscamente.

translation.en: - Very gently. - Yes, sir.
On my count. One, two, three.
translation.es: A la cuenta de tres. Uno, dos, tres.

translation.en: And we do it this way.
Don't move.
- - Piggott, look.
Where did you find it, darling? You clever girl.
Phillips!
- Look at this, sir. - Look. Look!
- Ah, good Lord. - His face!
- Mrs. Pretty, there's more. - And here. And here too.
translation.es: - Sra. Pretty, hay más. - Aquí y allí.

translation.en: There's much more.
Could you both, uh, cast your eyes on this, please?
I, uh, found it down between the strikes.
I believe that's a Merovingian tremissis.
translation.es: Creo que es un tremís merovingio, de finales del siglo VI.

translation.en: - Late 6th century. - Can't be.
translation.es: Creo que es un tremís merovingio, de finales del siglo VI. No puede ser.

translation.en: Viking East Anglia didn't have a coin- based economy till the 9th century.
translation.es: La economía vikinga de Anglia Oriental no tuvo monedas hasta el siglo IX.

translation.en: Well, I think that the ship is older.
Mr. Brown has always said so.
translation.es: Es la tesis del Sr. Brown.

translation.en: This is Anglo- Saxon.
Piggott! Grimes!
It's Dark Age, by Jupiter!
Sixth century!
This changes everything.
These people were not just marauding barterers.
translation.es: No eran solo maleantes que hacían trueques.

translation.en: They had culture!
They had art!
They had money!
Well, Vikings are out the window.
- C.W., look. - God's sake.
Oh, good God.
Brown has just shown me a Merovingian tremissis.
translation.es: Brown me acaba de mostrar un tremís merovingio.

translation.en: - - That's Anglo- Saxon.
It's incredible!
Hello. Are you camping out here?
No. That's where my cousin Rory sleeps.
translation.es: No. Ahí duerme mi primo Rory.

translation.en: Is he not allowed indoors?
No, he… he thinks the house is too hot.
translation.es: La casa le parece muy caliente.

translation.en: - I can imagine. - He's going to join the RAF.
translation.es: Me lo imagino. Se alistará en la Fuerza Aérea.

translation.en: - Is he? - They're sending his papers any day.
translation.es: - ¿En serio? - Lo citarán en cualquier momento.

translation.en: He's going to get his wings.
Well done, everybody, on a splendid effort.
Brailesford, Piggott, if you'll start loading the gold into the car,
translation.es: Brailsford, Piggott, suban el oro al auto.

translation.en: we'll get it straight to the British Museum.
I beg your pardon?
Well, it's the obvious place for it, Mrs. Pretty.
London is preparing for air raids.
translation.es: Londres se prepara para ataques aéreos.

translation.en: The British Museum is currently being emptied of its treasures, isn't it?
translation.es: Están sacando los tesoros del Museo Británico.

translation.en: Uh, yes, but, um, it… it'll go to the lab.
translation.es: Sí, pero estará en el laboratorio.

translation.en: This treasure came from someone's grave.
translation.es: El tesoro viene de una tumba.

translation.en: There'll be an inquest, as you know, and its fate will be decided there.
translation.es: La investigación forense decidirá qué hacer.

translation.en: Until then, Mr. Brown… as the finder of this magnificent ship,
translation.es: Hasta entonces, Sr. Brown, ya que halló este barco magnífico,

translation.en: would you please take the treasure up to the house?
Uh, yes, Mrs. Pretty.
Thank you all very much.
Right, uh, gentlemen, I'll need some assistance. Mr. Lomax?
This is most irregular.
It all belongs to Mrs. Pretty, doesn't it?
translation.es: Le pertenece a la Sra. Pretty, ¿no?

translation.en: It's found on her land.
Well, surely, the inquest will decide
whether the treasure belongs to Mrs. Pretty or the Crown.
translation.es: si es de la Sra. Pretty o la Corona.

translation.en: Piggott, do you want this treasure to go to the Ipswich Museum?
translation.es: Piggott, ¿quiere que lo lleven al Museo de Ipswich?

translation.en: Am I doing the right thing?
It's someone's grave.
No, that's… that's life what's revealed.
translation.es: No, es… Nos revela una forma de vida.

translation.en: And that's why we dig.
Just in here. I think that's best.
They're like emissaries from another world.
I used to camp with Robert's father, you see.
translation.es: Solía acampar con el padre de Robert.

translation.en: I remember him telling me the calls of all the birds.
translation.es: Me enseñó a distinguir el canto de las aves.

translation.en: Now, whenever I hear nightingales, I think of these woods.
translation.es: Los ruiseñores me recuerdan estos bosques.

translation.en: - Are there nightingales? - Haven't you heard them?
Never heard a nightingale at all. Only on the wireless.
translation.es: Solo he oído el canto de los ruiseñores en la radio.

translation.en: There's a wonderful cellist called Beatrice Harrison.
In the summer evenings, she used to practice in the garden, and…
translation.es: solía practicar en el jardín en las noches de verano.

translation.en: one night, she was playing a scale, and a… a nightingale joined in.
translation.es: Una noche, practicaba una escala y un ruiseñor se le unió.

translation.en: At first, she couldn't believe it. She started playing a sonata,
translation.es: No lo podía creer. Comenzó a tocar una sonata y el ruiseñor la acompañó.

translation.en: and the nightingale accompanied her.
translation.es: Comenzó a tocar una sonata y el ruiseñor la acompañó.

translation.en: - Really? - Mm- hmm. Yes.
Yes. It happened again the next night and next night.
translation.es: Sí, lo mismo sucedió las siguientes dos noches.

translation.en: Miss Harrison was so excited about it, she went to the BBC and told them all about it.
translation.es: Harrison se emocionó tanto que le contó a la BBC.

translation.en: And?  So, a few evenings later,
the BBC came and put their recording equipment in Miss Harrison's garden.
translation.es: la BBC instaló un equipo de grabación en el jardín.

translation.en: She started to play, and they waited and, um, waited…
translation.es: Comenzó a tocar y esperaron un rato largo.

translation.en: and…
and at last, the nightingale began to sing.
translation.es: por fin el ruiseñor comenzó a cantar.

translation.en: Went on for about 15 minutes…
rising and falling with the cello.
translation.es: Cambiaba de nota con el violonchelo.

translation.en: - No. -
- Yes. - Wow.
I know. Hmm.
But… the really extraordinary thing is that…
other people who'd been listening to the broadcast in their gardens
translation.es: que quienes escuchaban la transmisión en sus jardines

translation.en: reported that other nightingales also started to sing.
translation.es: informaron que otros ruiseñores también comenzaron a cantar.

translation.en: Well, that's wonderful.
Yes, it was. It was wonderful.
Margaret!
- Come on! - All right. Hmm.
Well… good night.
I shall listen out for cellos in the woods.
translation.es: Estaré pendiente de violonchelos en el bosque.

translation.en: Cellos.
- Here we are, chaps. - All right.
Well, we are unburying a legend.
- Beowulf. - Arthur, King of the Britons.
Cheers.
Talk about Dark Ages. I can hardly see my pint.
translation.es: Beber cerveza así me hace sentir en la Edad Media.

translation.en: What actually is that?
It's the, uh, trial blackouts, C.W.
translation.es: Es un simulacro para los apagones.

translation.en: So Germans will be coming by air this time, will they?
Last time, they came by the river.
In AD 600.
You know, I'm… It's been a big day. I'm quite done in.
translation.es: Me siento… Fue un día emocionante. Estoy agotada.

translation.en: Um, will you all excuse me?
translation.es: Fue un día emocionante. Estoy agotada. Me voy a retirar.

translation.en: - Aw. - Well done, Mrs. P, on a marvelous find.  Yes. Cheers to your clever wife!
translation.es: - Felicitaciones por el hallazgo. - Salud por su esposa tan lista.

translation.en: - Yeah. No, I'll come with you, darling. - No.
No, no. Um, surely you want to celebrate.
translation.es: - Voy contigo. - No es necesario. Quieres celebrar.

translation.en: - Stay for another, Piggott. - My round. Set them up again, would you?
translation.es: - Tómate otra. - Es mi turno de pagar. ¡Otra ronda!

translation.en: I say, C.W., ask him if he'll take a Merovingian tremissis.
translation.es: Pregunta si podemos pagar con un tremís merovingio.

translation.en: …the press campaign,
the menacing statements of the statesmen leading the policy of Germany,
translation.es: las declaraciones de los líderes políticos alemanes,

translation.en: the systematic provocation of frontier incidents,
translation.es: la provocación sistemática de incidentes fronterizos

translation.en: and finally, the constantly increasing concentrations of mobilized armed forces
translation.es: y, por último, el aumento de la movilización de las fuerzas armadas

translation.en: at the Polish frontiers constitute an obvious proof of this.
translation.es: en la frontera polaca es una prueba obvia de esto.

translation.en: A Labour deputation called on the Prime Minister last night,
translation.es: Una delegación laborista le pidió al primer ministro

translation.en: requesting the immediate evacuation of women, children, and cripples
translation.es: la evacuación inmediata de mujeres, niños e inválidos

translation.en: as precaution against the sudden outbreak of war.
translation.es: como precaución si la guerra empieza.

translation.en: He'll find Buck Rogers if anybody can.
translation.es: como precaución si la guerra empieza. …encontrar a Buck Rodgers.

translation.en: Get the guards, you fools!
translation.es: ¡Llamen a los guardias! Si escapan, ¡todos irán al batallón de robots!

translation.en: If they get away, I'll put every man of you in the robot battalion!
translation.es: Si escapan, ¡todos irán al batallón de robots!

translation.en: Not yet.
Not yet.
Darling, C.W. wants me to take some of the corroded iron to the lab.
translation.es: Cariño, C. W. quiere que lleve un poco de hierro corroído al laboratorio.

translation.en: Uh, we think it might be fragmented armor, and I… I badly want to start cleaning it up. So…
translation.es: Quizá sea un fragmento de armadura y quiero empezar a limpiarlo.

translation.en: Am I to come with you?
No, because C.W. needs all the hands he can get here, so, uh…
translation.es: No, porque C. W. necesita personal aquí. Y está muy contento con tu desempeño.

translation.en: And he's very pleased with you.
translation.es: Y está muy contento con tu desempeño.

translation.en: - Is he? - Mm.
Uh, so I'm taking Brailesford because the lab's really his thing.
translation.es: Iré con Brailsford porque el laboratorio es su especialidad.

translation.en: You're going to have to be a brick about it, Margaret.  Peggy.
translation.es: - Tendrás que ser confiable, Margaret. - Peggy.

translation.en: My name's Peggy.
I'll… I'll… I'll miss you very much, Peggy.
translation.es: Te voy a echar de menos, Peggy.

translation.en: Sorry to take him away from you.
It was very kind of you to invite me, Mrs. Pretty.
translation.es: Qué amable de su parte invitarme.

translation.en: You can't possibly stay in that pub without your husband.
translation.es: No puede quedarse en la taberna sin su esposo.

translation.en: Mr. Phillips would bore you quite to death.
Um, have you developed any of your photographs yet, Mr. Lomax?
I've made a start. I've got a mountain to do, and I better get through them.
translation.es: Apenas comencé. Son muchas y debo terminarlas.

translation.en: I could get my papers any day.
Rory has been accepted into the RAF.
translation.es: Aceptaron a Rory en la Fuerza Aérea.

translation.en: Should I congratulate you?
I don't know. Cousin Edith didn't.
translation.es: No lo sé. Mi prima no me felicitó.

translation.en: This looks delicious.
Bon appétit.
Don't be too long, now, darling. It's late.
And now, that's a partial eclipse of the moon.
And don't run.
Oh, dear.
- Isn't that a bad omen? - Well, they used to think so.
translation.es: ¿Es un mal presagio? Eso creían antes.

translation.en: It does make you feel the gods are angry.
translation.es: Parece que los dioses se enojaron.

translation.en: The people who buried that ship…
What did they believe?
Well… they were sailing somewhere, weren't they?
Down to the underworld or up to the stars.
translation.es: Navegaban al inframundo y a las estrellas.

translation.en: Wherever we go when we die.
translation.es: Adonde sea que vayamos al morir.

translation.en: So we're rather coming to the dregs, aren't we?
The coroner has been in touch.
An inquest has been called for Friday, and your presence is required.
translation.es: La investigación será el viernes y deben asistir.

translation.en: There's been quite a lot of public interest in our ship.
translation.es: Ha habido mucho interés en nuestro barco.

translation.en: So afterwards, I've invited everyone to come and see it.
translation.es: Invité a todos a verlo después.

translation.en: Uh… everyone?
The villagers are coming and my friends from the county.
translation.es: A los habitantes del pueblo y mis amigos del condado.

translation.en: May I remind you just how fragile this site is?
translation.es: Le recuerdo que esta excavación es delicada.

translation.en: Please feel free to invite your families and friends.
translation.es: Inviten a sus familias y a sus amigos.

translation.en: Mrs. Pretty…
Good God.
Robert?
Don't let anyone swim! It's tidal. The current is fierce!
translation.es: Que nadie entre al agua. La corriente es peligrosa. Ven.

translation.en: They train these boys on rickety planes from the Great War.
translation.es: Los entrenan en aviones destartalados de la Gran Guerra.

translation.en: My husband said, If you want your son to die, then let him join the Air Force.
translation.es: Mi esposo decía: Si quieres a tu hijo muerto, que se una a la Fuerza Aérea.

translation.en: They say this war will be fought in the air.
translation.es: Esta guerra se librará en el aire.

translation.en: What happened, Mother?
Is he all right?
- I must get Robert up to the house. - Shall I take him for you?
translation.es: - Debo llevar a Robert a la casa. - ¿Lo llevo?

translation.en: - He won't want to go. - Uh, I'll ask him to look after me.
translation.es: No va a querer ir. Le diré que me cuide.

translation.en: Thank you.
Robert!
- Yes? - I… I feel rather faint.
Oh, well, when I feel faint, I have a good lie- down
translation.es: Cuando me siento así, me recuesto.

translation.en: and a big glass of water.
- Do you? - And that does the trick.
translation.es: - También bebo agua. - ¿Sí? - Eso funciona. - Es lo que necesito.

translation.en: That's what I need.
translation.es: - Eso funciona. - Es lo que necesito.

translation.en: - Will you take my hand? - Sure.
His name was David Atkinson. It was his second solo flight.
translation.es: Se llamaba David Atkinson. Era su segundo vuelo solo.

translation.en: Police and the coroner are here. I brought you some dry things.
translation.es: La policía y el forense vinieron. Le traje ropa seca.

translation.en: I've got some coffee back at my tent.
Would you like some?
My father drowned…
on a holiday in Cornwall.
He was taken by the current.
- I'm sorry. - Oh, no.
It was a long time ago.
He had epilepsy.
So, what drew you to photography?
Oh, I suppose it's, um… It's just a way of trying to fix things as they…
translation.es: Supongo que es una forma de registrar las cosas

translation.en: as they go past.
- Mm. - Keep what's vital from being lost.
My father once gave me an old coin…
translation.es: Mi padre… me regaló una moneda,

translation.en: and he said it was from the time of Caesar Augustus.
translation.es: y dijo que era de la época de César Augusto.

translation.en: And I knew the story from the Bible where Jesus showed the disciples a coin.
translation.es: Conocía la historia en que Jesús les muestra una moneda a los discípulos.

translation.en: Render unto Caesar the things that are Caesar's.
translation.es: Dad al César lo que es del César.

translation.en: - - Yes.
And I…
…well, I… I became convinced that the coin I had
translation.es: Estaba convencida de que mi moneda

translation.en: was the one that Jesus had actually shown the disciples.
translation.es: era la que Jesús les mostró a los discípulos.

translation.en: I used to marvel that I could hold it.
What happened to your coin?
- I wear it.  -
I thought it might bring me luck.
And has it?
If 1,000 years…
were to pass in an instant…
what would be left of us?
This.
And parts of your watch.
Torch.
Fragments of the mug.
But every last scrap of you and I would… disappear.
- Listen. -
What?
The pilot died, didn't he?
Yes, darling.
Wait.
- - Rory won't die, will he?
I'm sorry.
You won't die?
Mrs. Pretty?
- Are you unwell? - I've, um…
- Perhaps you might lead me to my room. - Yes, of course. Of course.
translation.es: - ¿Me ayuda a ir a mi cuarto? - Por supuesto.

translation.en: - - Are you all right?
Yes! Yes.
- Should I call a doctor? - No, no, no. It's… It's heartburn. It's…
translation.es: - ¿Llamo al médico? - No, es solo acidez.

translation.en: - - Mrs. Pretty, are you all right?
I'm such a bore.
Would you mind… Would you mind getting me some milk?
- Yes. - Thank you.
- Are you sure? - Yes, thank you.
- Oh. - Robert! Darling…
- - Oh! Robert.
- - You all right?
Robert?
I know she's sick. I know it! There's nothing I can do!
translation.es: Sé que está enferma, y no puedo hacer nada.

translation.en: Why is there nothing I can do? I should be able to make her better.
translation.es: ¿Por qué no puedo hacer nada? Debería poder hacerla sentir mejor.

translation.en: You do. You do make her better.
No, she's worse. She is, I can see it!
When… When my father died…
…everyone said I had to look after my mother.
translation.es: todos me dijeron que cuidara a mamá.

translation.en: And I failed.
I failed.
…we all fail.
Every day.
There are some things we just can't succeed at…
no matter how hard we try.
I know it's not what you want to hear.
translation.es: No es lo que quieres oír.

translation.en: I… I'm stronger than she thinks I am.
translation.es: Soy más fuerte de lo que ella cree.

translation.en: I know. Perhaps you'll show her.
translation.es: Lo sé. Quizás ya se lo demuestres.

translation.en: Now…
we should get you inside, Robert.
Come on.
I think it's time for your bed, you know. Come on, then.
translation.es: Ya es hora de acostarse. Vamos.

translation.en: Apparently, there's a whole convoy of hacks on the way.
translation.es: Parece que vienen varios periodistas ignorantes.

translation.en: I already have some joker from the Sunday Mirror asking me
translation.es: Un payaso del Sunday Mirror ya me preguntó

translation.en: if the ship is still seaworthy.
translation.es: si el barco aún puede navegar.

translation.en: So, what happens to the treasure? That's the real question.
translation.es: ¿Qué pasa con el tesoro? Esa es la pregunta importante.

translation.en: Germany has invaded Poland…  Have you seen my wife?
translation.es: - Alemania invadió Polonia… - ¿Viste a mi esposa?

translation.en: …and has bombed many towns.
Orders completing the mobilization of the Navy, Army, and Air Force
translation.es: El rey ordenó el despliegue de la Marina, el Ejército y la Fuerza Aérea

translation.en: were signed by the King at a meeting this afternoon of the privy council.
translation.es: en una reunión con el consejo de asesores esta tarde.

translation.en: The King and Queen decided...  Well.
translation.es: El rey y la reina seguirán en el Palacio de Buckingham.

translation.en: Here we go, then.
The Queen drove from the palace to visit the Westminister ARP headquarters.
translation.es: …la reina visitó el Mando de Defensa Aintiaérea.

translation.en: I've just received this.
I'm to report to RAF Martlesham this morning.
translation.es: Esta mañana, debo ir a la base de Martlesham.

translation.en: There's the inquest.
It's my medical assessment. I can't… I can't bunk it. Sorry.
translation.es: Me van a hacer el examen médico. No puedo faltar. ¡Lo siento!

translation.en: I put some photographs in the dining room for your guests.
translation.es: En el comedor, dejé fotos para los invitados.

translation.en: Rory, I'm telling you in no uncertain terms that you cannot possibly die.
translation.es: Roy, te advierto que no puedes morir.

translation.en: I'm saying this most seriously. Don't you dare put yourself in danger.
translation.es: Lo digo en serio. No corras riesgos.

translation.en: Well… I'm not sure I shall have much choice.
Robert is going to need you.
Do you understand?
Good morning, Robert.
- Today's the day. - I want to take my mother sailing.
translation.es: - Llegó el día. - Quiero llevar a navegar a mamá.

translation.en: I don't think that ship is sailing anywhere. You know, it's just compacted sand.
translation.es: Ese barco no irá a ningún lado. Es arena compactada.

translation.en: There's nothing holding it, except time.
translation.es: Se desintegró con el paso del tiempo.

translation.en: - That won't matter. Not where we're going. - Now, where's that, then?
- Will you come? - Well, if I'm invited, I'll come.
- Morning. - Hello.
Those for me?
No, I'm looking for my wife.
Well, perhaps you'd say goodbye for me.
I've been called up.
Of course.
Well, best of British.
I… I bought you these.
How lovely.
Um, Lomax was just telling me that he's been called up.
- Uh, well, it… - Um…
Uh, I'd better go. Goodbye.
According to an official telegram, Warsaw has been bombed six times today.
translation.es: Según un telegrama oficial, hoy bombardearon Varsovia seis veces.

translation.en: The telegram adds that fighting of a most serious nature continues
on the whole length of the front.
We're in for another bloody mess.
Oh, here we go. Did you hear the results?
- I just want a quick photo! - Mrs. Pretty!
Please, make way.
Make way, please.
- Do you want me in the car with you? - Yes.
Maynard! Maynard!
Maynard? Can you make sure my wife gets in the house?
translation.es: Lleve a mi esposa a la casa.

translation.en: I… I hope I have the opportunity to speak to you later.
- Mrs. Pretty? - Mrs. Pretty!
I'm terribly sorry.
These people were not savage warriors.
These… These… These were… These were sophisticated people with incredible artistry.
translation.es: Eran sofisticados y tenían un gran sentido artístico.

translation.en: The Dark Ages are no longer dark.
translation.es: La Edad Media no fue una época oscura.

translation.en: This is sherry. I suppose it's sherry, is it?  I don't know.
Should we drink it now, or is there going to be a toast?
What's everyone else doing?
The artifacts discovered here have caused a national sensation.
translation.es: Los artefactos hallados aquí causaron furor en el país.
